definition: to kneel and bow with joined hands at forehead level/to worship
to prostrate oneself in worship (idiom)/(fig.) to worship/to bow down to

sentences.english: Wilde went on to become homosexual worship the "ancestral."
sentences.chinese: 王尔德甚至成了同性恋者顶礼膜拜的“祖师爷”。

sentences.english: The altar, as in prehistory, is anywhere you kneel.
sentences.chinese: 如同在史前，你膜拜的地方就是祭堂。

sentences.english: One day he asked me if I'd help him with the youth group's worship service.
sentences.chinese: 有一天，他问我能不能在他的膜拜仪式中帮忙。

sentences.english: Worldly people bow the knee to success as to god.
sentences.chinese: 市井小人崇拜成功犹如膜拜上帝。

sentences.english: The old lady fell down in adoration before Buddhist images.
sentences.chinese: 那老太太在佛像面前顶礼膜拜。

sentences.english: Kindness in mind, incenses in hands, sincerely pray for blessings.
sentences.chinese: 心存善念，手存香，虔诚膜拜，求泰来。

sentences.english: We want our children to be getting ready to worship the Lord, too.
sentences.chinese: 我们也想让孩子们为膜拜上帝做好准备。

sentences.english: Wilde went on to become homosexual worship the "God of ancestors."
sentences.chinese: 王尔德甚至成了同性恋者顶礼膜拜的“祖爷”。
人们对着自制的神像顶礼膜拜。

sentences.english: It served as administrative center and place of worship for a prosperous kingdom.
sentences.chinese: 它的功能是行政中心以及为王国繁荣而膜拜的场所。

sentences.english: When all people knew the information, they came to the temple, kneeled and worshiped the jade figure.
sentences.chinese: 百姓们知道这个消息，都去向翡翠佛顶礼膜拜。

sentences.english: People go to the cinema to worship the idols on screen.
sentences.chinese: 人们去电影院是去膜拜荧幕上的偶像。

sentences.english: He is still the writer before whom everyone from Faulkner to Mailer has knelt.
sentences.chinese: 不管是福克纳还是梅勒，他依然是他们膜拜的对象。

sentences.english: The altar as in prehistory is anywhere you kneel.
sentences.chinese: 如同在史前，你膜拜的地方就是祭堂。

sentences.english: They refrained from genuflecting to the laws of political economy.
sentences.chinese: 他们拒不向政治经济学定律顶礼膜拜。

definition: to prostrate oneself in worship (idiom)/(fig.) to worship/to bow down to
to admire/to revere/to look up to
to worship/to make customary deferences to/a pilgrimage
to prostrate oneself in admiration (idiom); to adulate sb
to look up at/to look up to sb hopefully
to tilt one's head back to see (sth)/to look up at
